TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit ActivityTrackingCondition extends System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingCondition

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Represents a condition that compares the value of an activity member to a specified value by using a specified comparison operator.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
You can use an <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition> to constrain a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> or an <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingLocation>.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public ActivityTrackingCondition ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
Public Sub New ()
public: ActivityTrackingCondition();

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you use the default constructor, you must explicitly set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition.Member%2A>. You must also set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition.Value%2A>. The default value of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition.Operator%2A> is `Equals`.

Docs.param: The dot delineated name of an activity member.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by specifying an activity member and a value for comparison.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition.Member%2A> is set to `member`, and <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition.Value%2A> is set to `value`. The default value of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition.Operator%2A> is `Equals`.

Docs.exception: is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Member { get; set; }
.property instance string Member
Public Overrides Property Member As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ Member { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Member : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the activity member that is to be compared with .
Docs.value: The dot delineated name of the activity member

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can specify an activity property or field, a member of an activity property or field, or a single element of an activity property or field (or a member of either) that implements the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> interface. For example, you can specify a single element of a collection.
If you use the default constructor for <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition>, you must explicitly set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition.Member%2A>.
The value of the specified activity member is compared with <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition.Value%2A> by applying <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition.Operator%2A>.
## Examples The following code sample demonstrates accessing the Member property. This example is from the Tracking Profile Designer SDK sample. For more information, see [Tracking Profile Designer Sample](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-3.5/ms742004(v=vs.90)).
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#120](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets1.cs#120)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#120](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets1.vb#120)]

Docs.exception: The condition was evaluated and is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
The condition was evaluated and is incorrectly formed.
The condition was evaluated and does not refer to a valid activity member.

Docs.summary: The value that is to be compared with .
Docs.value: The value used in the comparison.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition.Value%2A> is compared to the value of
<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition.Member%2A> by applying <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition.Operator%2A>.
If you use the default constructor for <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition>, you must explicitly set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition.Value%2A>.
## Examples The following code sample demonstrates accessing the Value property. This example is from the Tracking Profile Designer SDK sample. For more information, see [Tracking Profile Designer Sample](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-3.5/ms742004(v=vs.90)).
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#120](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets1.cs#120)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#120](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets1.vb#120)]
